content: नित्य {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [नियमेन नियतं वा भवं नि-त्यप्; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>P. IV. 2. 104</ls> <ab>Vārt.</ab>] {@--1@} ({%a%}) Continual, perpetual, constant, ever-lasting, eternal, uninterrupted; यदि नित्यमनित्येन लभ्यते <ls>H. 1. 48</ls>; नित्यज्योत्स्नाः प्रतिहतमोवृत्तिरम्याः प्रदोषाः <ls>Me.</ls> (regarded by <ls>Malli.</ls> as an interpolation); <ls>Ms. 2. 206.</ls> ({%b%}) Imperishable, indestructible; पृथिवी द्विविधा नित्याऽनित्या च <ls>Tarka K.</ls> {@--2@} Invariable, regular, fixed, not optional, regularly prescribed (<ab>opp.</ab> काम्य). {@--3@} Necessary, obligatory, essential. {@--4@} Ordinary, usual (<ab>opp.</ab> नैमित्तिक). {@--5@} (At the end of <ab>comp.</ab>) Constantly dwelling in, perpetually engaged in or busy with; जाह्नवीतीर°, अरण्य°, आदान°, ध्यान° &c. --त्यः The ocean. --त्या An epithet of the goddess Durgā. --त्यं An indispensable or inevitable act. --त्यं {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} Daily, constantly, always, ever, perpetually, eternally.
